page.title: 12Mr. Lidgett. Part Three.
page.content: At one time the village had a mobile shop that used to call every week but now they have to shop in Corringham and Gainsborough. Mr. and Mrs. Lidgett have a very good postman who brings their pension and runs errands for them. They told us that until recently if you were ill and wanted the doctor to call you put a white flag in the hedge in front of your house on the day that the doctor drove through the village. That was before most people had telephones. For our final question we asked Mr. Lidgett what he thought was the biggest change he has seen in his lifetime.He told us it was the use of machinery on the farms. When he was a boy all of the work was done by hand and horses. Now they use tractors and machines so less men work in the area.
